* Hand sanitizer will be added to every classroom and kept full by janitors.
* Janitorial staff will use hospital grade disinfectant cleaners regularly throughout every that school is in session.

Being a small school is especially beneficial now, as schools across the nation grapple with how to conduct learning in the fall and when to reopen their doors. - We will be capping all classes at 20 students

- We will have spaced out seating in classrooms in rows instead of clusters of desks.
- A restroom schedule has been developed that ensures full sanitation of facilities between groups.
- Our eLearning programming will remain strong so that students whose families are impacted by the virus can continue learning offsite in quarantined conditions.
Stay tuned for more updates regarding Inspire Academy‚Äôs Safe Re-entry Plan!

Today, June 5th, is National Gun Violence Awareness Day. Join the Inspire crew and others throughout the country as we #WearOrange to honor survivors of gun violence and support awareness around gun safety.

Joe'siah, grade 4, shared his powerful story and perspective on Wear Orange Day at last year's Giving Gala. Read Joe'siah's story:
"[Wear Orange Day] is something we do at our school where we talk about people's parents or someone else in their family that was murdered by a gun or something violent. On this day, we wear orange shirts and we go in a room and we talk about it and how we feel. We also make videos on how to stop gun violence. And we don‚Äôt want people to kill other people not just with guns, but with anything! ... I lost my dad who was shot by a gun. The Inspire staff and I talk about it and this helps me deal with the pain and helps me feel better. I love the staff and this school."

Learn more about Wear Orange here: https://wearorange.org
